review_title: It’s a good place to retire from
job_title: Pharmacy Technician I in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Amazing pharmacists! OU Health will pay for your National License the first time you take it. Great insurance, I pay nothing for my regular medications for my husband and I. It is a great environment if you do your job and do it well. Opportunities for growth.
cons: Too much horseplay after the boss leaves.

review_title: May have accidentally joined a cult
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Tulsa, OK
pros: Everyone is so warm and they don’t seem to hate being there. There isn’t as big a focus of getting every penny from people since they make money from the school and fundraising. Tons of PTO, 14 paid holidays, tuition discounts, friendly management.
cons: The pay is not great. I picked my mental health over more money. I was just tired of dreading going to work.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Good benefits, good service, good structure
cons: Holidays come out of you PTO

job_title: Senior Medical Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Their pay went up some, but not enough.
cons: They took away some of the employee PTO and gave it to doctors/administration . Literally they sent out the plan on how this was to happen with a chart that showed where the PTO was going. The staff is overworked and not payed well enough for their services not to mention they changed their health insurance to where it's difficult to go to a doctor outside of OU.

review_title: Credentialing Department is a horrid mess
job_title: Credentialing Specialist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Discounts through the hospital, good benefits,
cons: The interim director of the department has absolutely no skills in leadership, management or being a team player. Consistent negative attitude and persona, talks down to employees, berates them when they cannot "keep up" with an impossible workload and refuses to do the same work she tells her department to do.

job_title: Accounts Payable Lead in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Sometimes you get lucky and get to work with a great group of people.
cons: Compensation is not up to standard. Well below norm.

job_title: Nurse Technician in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Nurses are nice there. The hospital is clean and the food is good.
cons: Low pay. For 8 years as a tech and in nursing school they paid me 14 an hour. How ridiculous. High turnover.

review_title: Still feels like HCA owned, with the earliest version of Meditech

pros: Coworkers are helpful, work environment is ok. The company tired to promote employee wellness.
cons: Oldest version of Meditech. Still waiting for Epic change over for a few years now. Patient acuity 3-4 BMT and 4-6 everywhere else. Some RNs are still on the 8hr shift that disrupts patient care,everyone else's schedule and acuity of patients change with additional patie t load because they aren't enough staffing (even the external contractors or PRN staff isn't enough).

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Oklahoma City, OK

review_title: Not what it used to he

cons: OU has taken away 4 of our PTO days and also took away our 401k matching as of January 2023. They also laid off over 100 people in January 2023. This has caused extra work and stress on remaining employees. Promised raises for managers have not been given.

job_title: RN Manager in Oklahoma City, OK

job_title: Genetic Counselor in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Local to OK, in large medical center Large hospital
cons: OUH merger has significantly impacted OUH finances, causing things like pay cuts, layoffs, freezing 401K contributions, and cutting PTO accrual by 32 hours, many employees are frequently unhappy. There is not a lot of transparency. Execs make decisions that significantly impact healthcare workers and their lives and make minimal efforts to actually provide valuable benefits or compensation to workers.

review_title: Low pay, under appreciated by upper hospital management
job_title: Histotechnologist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Hours can be flexible, some awesome people stay despite the issues
cons: Very low pay for anyone but nurses/Dr’s and minimum wage employees. The benefits cost continues to jump and options decline. Holiday bonus was equivalent to a 20$ gift card. Many positions require a BS/BA degree but pay 20$/hr. No funds for obtaining or maintaining licenses.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK

job_title: Student Nurse Technician in Oklahoma City, OK

review_title: Even if it’s writing…don’t trust them.
job_title: Sr Patient Service Coordinator in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The view is nice from the SCC.
cons: Zero transparency. No communication from Top down to clinical operations, and/or it’s very limited. HR is non-existent or ridiculously impossible to reach or contact. Benefits are a facade and can be reduced or cancelled without your consent. Total Health Rewards program is an outright scam, confirm confirm confirm what they tell you and get it in writing but even then don’t trust what you’ve been told. Read your benefit elections carefully, especially your PTO. You don’t accrue as much as other competitive jobs. Your pay won’t be competitive but it is an “academic” healthcare workspace, just without the actual academia. Expect a toxic work culture, environment when it comes to respecting boundaries. You will be asked to do more for less money, they will call it “cross-training” and won’t hire someone to fill an empty slot if you can makeup another person’s work. ***If you identify anywhere on the LGBTQ+ spectrum don’t work there unless you feel like being the model minority token of the clinic.*** Protect your peace and mental well-being and strongly think before accepting a job here. If you have another option, take it. Get used to sudden changes in work duties or being asked to “ say yes” or “keep the faith” which translates to take on more work for no compensation. This place is a fantastic example of work culture gone wrong and the effect it has on revenue, staff, and the health of its employees/patients. The only positive is that for some reason the patients are kind despite being screwed over by a company that places profits over patient care. Finally, I wasn’t one of the employees laid off but I’ve worked at OU health long enough to know being laid off would have been a better alternative than sitting on a sinking ship.

job_title: Manager in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: I do really like my coworkers but in a POW bond type of way. We're all in this suffering together trying to keep our heads above water and trying our best to help each other despite what the organization keeps throwing at us.
cons: HORRIBLE upper-level management, financial problems, and "temporary" freezing of 401k matching and PTO. We had a company-wide meeting to discuss how we're 30 days away from running out of money and their solution was to implement these changes and lay off 100 people.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK

job_title: Laboratory Scientist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The benefits are great. Most of my coworkers are a good group of people. Free snacks and goodies throughout the year. The therapy dogs are always nice to see and pet.
cons:
Turnover rate is high due to horrible management.

The communication is lacking. Management is out of touch and it will seem like you’re talking to a brick wall at times. You can tell management about issues but then the “solutions” don’t solve anything. Most “solutions” just cause more issues. 

People who slack off will never be reprimanded. If you’re a hard worker then you will be penalized for slacking off even if others slack off daily. People can make more than you but yet do nothing day in and day out. 

You can volunteer for whatever management is asking for but you will never feel appreciated for it. They will just expect you to volunteer every time moving forward. 

Management will only show up to point out everything that has gone wrong. That’s when you’ll mostly see management. When things are running smoothly the other 98% of the time then no one cares. 

Extremely toxic and negative work environment.

Most departments at OU are mismanaged. I have talked to people from pharmacy, oncology, nutrition, etc. I have seen mass exodus of up to half of some nursing departments. I have ex coworkers who refuse to ever work again for OU in the future and advise all of their friends to stay clear. 

Most areas are understaffed and most staff are underpaid. 

I think the biggest turning point for me was seeing my bubbly and happy coworkers become depressed and negative. I just don’t think my mental health is worth this mess.

Horrible parking.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Loved the people I worked with. Enjoyed the fast paced Er. Helping people is my passion. Worked a lot of overtime (6 days a week to be exact) to earn points to buy within our reward system.
cons: Didn't like being lied to. Ran late after working extra shifts and stayed late to help after scheduled to be off. Relief doesn't come on time and you have to stay until they come. Didn't get to use my reward points after I working overtime to get them and earned rightfully by myself. Then no compensations whatsoever for my rewards, never a call back from management after I got terminated, no reasoning behind me not getting to use my points. When I got terminated I tried to ask questions about the system the same day I was locked out not even 5 minutes after walking to different department.

job_title: Supply Chain in Wichita, KS
pros:
Good benefits 
It’s a job
cons:
Over worked, 
under paid
Not appreciated 
Allow people to retaliate without punishment

job_title: Cta in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: It is a good starter career location
cons: Pay is not super competitive

job_title: Transplant Coordinator in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Professional Co-Workers. Compassionate Staff. Sebastian and Hawxby are excellent surgeons.
cons: Can be hours. Call. Work 24, 7 on occasion. Not off when you are off.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Some good people. Pay is average.
cons: Charting system is terrible. New time clocks are overly complicated. Parking is a pain.

review_title: No job description, highly critical supervisor with subjective job performance reviews
job_title: HAN Care Coordinator in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Monday- Friday 8 to 5 with low work load.  OU has a rule of no computer use except work.
cons:
Staring at the computer is over rated when all patient's have been contacted and 10 out of 12 do not answer the phone.
Performance expectations were unclear for a case manager.  The work as presented was to complete specific information pages for each class of patient, i.e. Breast and Cervical cancer, emergency room usage, Asthma and a few other groups of high need patients.  There were vizio's to guide the timing expectation of contacts.  
Politic viewpoint was very emphasized. Glenda the manager in Tulsa noted when asked about a nurse she hired, "she thinks like us". "She's one of us. "  This is a new position and will be in year two with this contract with the Tulsa HAN and OHCA lasting until December, 2015.  
Management is local at OU Physician's with a local view of the program and the direction desired.  And Tulsa OU who have written the Health Access Network (HAN) contract with OHCA.  The supervisor's there mention a desire for a regional case management center.  And the cases originated from the OHCA.  Oklahoma Health Care Authority (OHCA).  
The work environment was amazingly critical from day one.

job_title: Histotechnician in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great technology, growing fast, willing to teach
cons: Operates like a big cooperation

job_title: Registered Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
I really did love my job at OU Medical. BUT, this is what happened to me: CON
A great place to learn, and connect. Professional, Try to do things the proper way to pass inspections and such. I felt really good about my job while employed there. I really liked my Sr management and co workers. I felt like I was a good employee there.
cons: I was badly injured in the Moore 2013 tornado, due to my 2 story house falling on top of me. I took some FMLA at the time. I was recommended to have rotator cuff surgery done when my shoulder did not improve, so I was on FMLA again. As soon as my restrictions were lifted, I was "layed off", permanently so it seems. I have since tried for several jobs there and not given a chance at even one of them. I had senority but it did not seem to matter (4 years)

review_title: very nice staff workers but administration is very unattached to management /employee relation in housekeeping.
job_title: Housekeeper II in Edmond, OK
pros: the company in most department has a good friendly staff, their benefits package is decent, office personnel are friendly and approachable.
cons: they have outsourced the environmental services dept and put in the hands of a contract company who places inexperienced people in management positions who do not have a clue how to relate to their employee's in a professional manor so instead of building up and motivating their staff they think bulling and threatening people is the way. HCA has knowledge of this and dont seam to be concerned or willing to get involved. (serious problem, shameful)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: I have been with OU Medicine for over 10 years. I am extremely grateful to this organization and its leaders for providing me with so many professional growth opportunities. The work and my colleagues have kept me engaged, challenged, and growing both professionally and personally over the years. Our organization has seen unprecedented growth and change over the last  few years which comes with it's challenges but I believe we have overcome each of those challenges and will continue to do so in order to achieve our mission of leading healthcare and improving the lives of all people in Oklahoma.
cons: Growth and change can be hard and we have been doing a lot of both lately!  We continue to invest in new technology and process improvement to meet the needs of our employees and patients. We have seen a lot of improvement over the last year but also know we still have some work to do.  I can't wait to see where we are in 2, 5, 10, and 20 years from now!

review_title: The business climate of hospitals are generally not satisfying workplaces
job_title: RN
pros:
Start off with matching 401k at 3%
Lots of horizontal mobility to different units.
Teaching hospital.
Trauma 1 facility.
Low cost limited life insurance.
Some units have a lot of equipment/technology.
You see all those nice buildings on campus? Not really HCA; foundations provide the cool things which is a pro and a con.
cons:
It takes 2 years to become 20% vested in 401k.
Constant flow of pompous residents.
Lack of doc ordered parameters.
HCA Rewards benefits package is a joke. The consumer savings programs don't save money.
Expensive short term disability insurance.
Corporate leaders constantly cashing out HCA's assets and making outstanding returns for themselves at the detriment of the company, its employees, and patients.
Mandatory assigned parking at off-site garage is time consuming and a hassle.
Some units lack a lot of equipment/technology.
Computerized charting is DOS (ancient) based.

review_title: I love working for OU Medical center, in the transplant unit for the hospital atmosphere and the experience I gained.
job_title: Medical Biller/Patient Registration in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The best reason for me to work there is because I really wanted to work in a hospital/clinic atmosphere and the job gave me a lot of experience in the vast medical billing field. I would like to return to hospital setting but I'm willing to work myself up the ladder with work experience to be able to return to the hospital medical unit.
cons: The one challenge I experienced while here at this job was trying to track down a Dr to verify his notes, for any errors a Dr had in his coding/notes etc.

job_title: Analyst in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: very supportive of work live balance and their employees want for higher education, the staff are wonderful, tuition reimbursement, benefits are good
cons: education given higher priority than quality experience - sometimes you're only seen by your degrees or lack their of, senior leadership talks a big game but doesn't always deliver, too much of an emphasis on title - if you aren't a director or above you are never really seen

review_title: Good place for healthcare  - Bad place to work
job_title: Management in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Benefits are fair.  Being a part of great healthcare
cons: Promotions based on personal relationships rather than experience and education.  Less than professional environment.   New employee are told the shuttle system is fast , this is not true.  Parking is a disaster !  Employees park in only the top levels of a parking garage , walk in a less than safe environment to a shuttle that is rarely on time only to ride a shuttle with drivers that are talking or texting as they drive.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great place to learn. If you can work efficiently at OU, you can go anywhere. Teaching Hospital, so you always have residents there at the ready.
cons: In order to advance you must be at the right place at the right time. It's for-profit and they do not care about employees over their bottom line. Less pay, more work. Lots of burn out.

job_title: Resident in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Oklahoma City is a good place to live.  The campus is growing and new buildings are continuing to go up.  Nursing staff is capable of handling things on own as compared to other university hospitals. Compared to other residency hospitals the salary is very reasonable considering the cost of living.
cons: Some of the residency programs (not all) can be very malignant.  The computer system is awful to use throughout both hospitals.  The ER is ran by a outside group with no residents.  Occasionally this mean ER docs will not do certain things that is usually expected of them.

review_title: Great place to work with growing opportunity
job_title: Talent Acquisition in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
The people are great, and are working towards a common goal of providing great healthcare to the community.
With the growth of the organization there is an opportunity to utilize a wide variety of professional skills and see opportunities for growth.  This is an exciting time to be part of an organization where you can feel like you are making a positive impact on the future.
cons: Due to the growth of the organization, there is also a lot of change in processes and ideas.  This is not necessarily a negative, but is something to keep in mind for current and future employees to understand the environment and the opportunity down the road.

job_title: Medical Assistant/Phlebotomist in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: I just moved here from Colorado, I've applied to OUMed in  early Sept got a call to come in for interview, 2.5 weeks later and was offered the job in 2 days, I'm new to the state and ready for my new adventure in Oklahoma and it's already starting in OU Med for my dream was to work in a University Hospital. I'm ready to get start and grow in my career.
cons: don't have not, but I'm sure parking will be one but it don't hurt to walk a few steps or so.

review_title: Great company, if you can find the right department for you.
job_title: Patient Navigator in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
Health benefits. OU pays the bulk of your insurance premiums. 
Great amount of time off - you accrue 18 hours every month. 20 hours a month once you've been with the company for 5 years.
cons: Some departments (Dermatology for example) are not managed very well and do not meet success sharing marks. Also difficult to move up in the smaller departments.

job_title: ICU RN in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: You get great experience with some of the sickest of the sick. Great learning environment. Great for handworkers. If you can work here for 2 years, you can handle anything else anywhere else. I had great coworkers who really understood teamwork.
cons: Not great if you don't like to be moving a lot. Not competitive pay. New grads are getting paid more than experienced nurses. Promises made, but not kept. My unit manager has not figured out how to retain nurses yet, young and old. High turnover.

job_title: Support in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
Growth:  We are building a new patient tower to take care of all of the patients we have.  Oklahoma should be proud! 

Benefits:  We just got more PTO and Life Insurance FREE!  Our retirement package was already good and they even made it better.

Leaders:  My leader is such a great support to our team.  We are lucky to have her.
cons: Very busy but that's a good thing -- we take care of the sickest of the sickest so Oklahomans should be proud.

review_title: A great place to make a difference, but not without company growing pains.
job_title: Director of Talent Acquisition in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The thousands of staff who are truly dedicated to the betterment of those patients and family cared for at OUM. The entire system slowly moving towards a fully integrated and optimized healthcare system.
cons: Not unexpected, but a major divestiture and extremely high growth in support areas cause  strain company wide. Even the best individuals and teams can only function so well when two thirds or more of a department are less then a year old.

review_title: No Growth with Favoritism/Friend-ism running rampant
job_title: Certified Medical Coder in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: -Great Benefits and PTO offering
cons:
-Favoritism runs rampant @ OU Children's Hospital
-People are prompted based on friends with bosses regardless of any experience history
-Bosses hire individuals who have zero history in the field or experience at higher payrate (i.e. food clerk at a higher pay then coder)
-When issues are brought up, they go into a black hole and then the higher ups pretend it never happened.
-If you ask for a higher rate, they will throw 10x more work at you for $0.10 increase
-If you ask for time off, even for surgery or pregnancy, they question everything about it
-Too many cons to list

review_title: The best place to begin your lifetime career
job_title: Nurse Manager in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: We have something for everyone here at OU Medicine! Oklahoma's only level I Trauma Center and the only level IV Neonatal ICU; elite PICU and Pediatric CVICU. From the Women's and Newborn Center to geriatrics, hematology/oncology, etc. We've got it all and we've got something that would be a perfect fit for you!
cons: We are growing and expanding at such a fast pace, it is difficult to keep up with parking needs of patients, families and staff. To ensure appropriate parking for our patients and visitors, day shift staff park offsite and are shuttled to work.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Decent pay, good people in  general. Respected within medical community.
cons:
Med-Surg floor/5:1 ratio too high, not nearly enough techs and the patients all require a high level of care. Accu checks on almost every patent AC and HS with many max assist patients is absolutely impossible to pass meds on time, chart CORRECTLY and PROVIDE QUALITY care. I feel so sorry for the patients. I was not able to provide the care I am very capable of because I was always forced to cut corners and make compromises in care.
Also, certain  areas require you to wear a TRACKING DEVICE! They tell you it is to monitor hand washing.hah! The device looks NOTHING like the small devices that are designed specifically for hand washing and do not work that way. The ones OU have monitor every movement and tell exactly where you are every minute..5 minutes here, 3 minutes here...the secretary informed me that I had been in the break room for longer than 7 minutes and accused me of trying to take a second lunch! Then when I was on lunch, (which you must CLOCK OUT FOR 30 MINUTE LUNCHES, ), the manager was able to find me on my lunch break in a quite place working on my homework ! I believe where I am on my lunch break is MY BUSINESS as long as follows hospital policy. That was the final straw...I went and hid the device behind a trash can and quit.

job_title: Graduate Student in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
-Non-profit hospital:  all of our revenue stays within the hospital and community.  With the burden of paying state and local taxes, this frees up capital to be put back into the hospital:  i.e. recruitment, facilities, supply, etc.  If you've ever worked in a for-profit hospital, you know how it feels to "do more with less."  The culture at OU has changed since HCA is no longer a part of it.
-Shared governance:  nurses and ancillary staff have a stay in policies and procedures when it comes to patient care and safety.
-Leadership:  I can attest that the leadership in the hospital is some of the BEST that I have had the pleasure of working for.  I truly believe that they all share a common goal:  they want the best for our patients while not sacrificing morale of their staff.
-Ownership and accountability:  This is OUr house.  Leadership wants everyone to have a vested interested in OU; they encourage employees to take ownership of the organization and with that ownership comes pride.
-Tuition reimbursement at 90 days of employment.  Need I say more?
-Clinical Recognition Program for RNs:  if you are certified in any area, or wish to become certified, you get extra money per year AND you don't even have to pay for the certification exam if you don't pass.  "No pass, no pay."
-MAGNET status:  We are in the process of submitting approval for MAGNET status.  Look it up!  So exciting.
-Benefits:  Are great and very cheap.
cons:
-Food:  The cafeteria is "OK."  Would like to see it expand.  This is possibly the smallest cafeteria I've seen for a hospital this size.
-Parking:  You have to park off-campus BUT a shuttle is offered.
-Pay:  I don't feel that as a staff nurse pay is comparable to some hospitals in the area.  I am hoping that this will change as I know this is a deterrent for some people.

job_title: Prefer Not To Say in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Large company. Experiencing phenomenal growth. Expansion will provide thousands of new jobs.
cons: Throughout most of the company, pay rate is based on the amount of experience the individual has in that field. Not exactly the case in HR. Depends more on who you know. Annual merit increases are better at other companies. Parking is huge issue. You may arrive to work on time under normal circumstances, but the employee shuttle may get you there late.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Tulsa, OK
pros: Excellent benefits, paid administration leave, 20hrs PTO monthly, no weekends
cons: Low start up pay, no yearly raise. I worked for 8yrs there & ended making $1.70 more than when I started. No overtime only comp time with stipulations when you can use it.  👎👎 Teaching facility but your paycheck don't reflect what you've taught. Communication is horrible,  the right hand never knows what the left is doing. High turnover

job_title: Pathology Laboratory Assistant in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Great work environment with good benefits. I worked in the laboratory under the children's hospital as a specimen processor. I really loved the job and the training was fast paced.
cons: The political environment can be a little bit stifling if you're not red. A lot of the people are strong advocates for the republican party and speak outwardly about it. It's Oklahoma though so it's not really unexpected.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: This is a great place to learn, since it’s the only Level 1 trauma center in Oklahoma. It is also a teaching hospital, so you will interact with residents, and there are a lot of educational opportunities offered. Many staff members are friendly and helpful, but it also depends on which unit you are in, like any hospital.
cons: Certain areas are chronically understaffed. It is a very busy and fast paced hospital, on most any unit. The MAR used is Meditech, which is very clunky and difficult to use.

job_title: N/A
pros: N/A
cons: N/A

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Recently became its own legal entity and non-profit.  Strong leadership across the organization.  A lot of new leaders bringing outside perspectives to make us better.  Leadership really cares about their employees.
cons: Because it's a new organization a lot of the "corporate" infrastructure is still in flux.  Benefits and PTO need updating but those improvements are underway.  Office space is severely limited and POB needs major updating.

job_title: Supply Chain Technician in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: It's absolutely a great place to work for an entry level position. Managers in our department is good. Regarding promotion, I think it's not easy, gotta work hard for it.
cons: Dealing with different requests from doctors, nurses, surgery tech, or even the residents, sometimes the request is far from the reality and they expect us to deliver them anyway.

job_title: in Norman, OK
pros: Great place to work, collaborative and friendly environment. The annual check-up attracts many OU students, and receives good feedback from those who used the service.
cons: Currently I can think of nothing. All the employees were enjoying many benefits from the current policy. Although, sometime the workload could be heavy.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Work with wonderful nurses and physicians, great teamwork, teaching hospital
cons: Corrupt upper management, only care about saving a buck, even if it comes at the cost of unsafe staffing, sacrificing good patient care, and running off all experienced staff. Pay is lower than most other metro hospitals, despite being the only Level 1 Trauma Center and taking the sickest patients.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Not for profit hospital with leadership that is caring and patient focused.  Work life balance at OU Medicine is very good. It is easy to work at OU and still have a good "away from work " quality of life.
cons: Parking could be improved.  The Shuttle service  provided from off site parking is nice, but adds extra time to the work day.

review_title: Nice Benefits and Pay for the Area
job_title: Maintenance in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Solid place to work and many people have been here for several years.
cons: To much Red Tape and an outside company (Sodexo) hired to Manage our department. It appears that Sodexo is slowing taking over our Department. They are constantly hiring more management and they cannot fill our open positions.

job_title: in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: This job is just ok. The benefits and pay I receive I believe are very good.
cons: The management shows favoritism to employees. Employees are not praised or rewarded adequately unless they are a boss' "pet." When higher management is aware of this but doesn't listen, you know there is a problem...

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Oklahoma City, OK
pros:
good mangers that don't micro manage you. working in the outpatient areas gives you standard hours while working in the emergency room you are bound to crazy shifts.
company offers paid holidays.
cons:
no room for advancement be prepared to stay in the same role until someone retires or leaves.
poor benefits
poor pay
paid holidays but you must use out of your PTO bucket rather than the company paying for it.

job_title: AUA in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: The nurses are friendly and help out.
cons: OU pays AUA's the exact same as CNA's and still wants you to draw blood and insert catheters. the Pay is around 10$-13$ a hour and recruiting is not straight forward about pay when making a offer. The email will not even have the information until you accept. Also once you work on a floor you cant go flex anymore... not worth it.

review_title: My experience with this facility was invaluable.  I worked with great experienced staff. You are always learning .
job_title: RN Trauma Services in Oklahoma City, OK
pros: Teaching environment. Great experience with staff years mix. Always looking for improvement.  Involved with community.
cons:
Salary. But that is changing to market compensation to match the market.
Hard place to work but invaluable experience.

review_title: There are ups and downs with my relationship here at OUMC, but the ups far out-weigh the downs.

level 1 trauma center and teaching hospital gives best experience to new grads

review_title: No staff in the blood bank

review_title: Great Place to Work - Five Stars!

job_title: Student Nurse Technician in Oklahoma City, OK

job_title: in Oklahoma City, OK
